pros: great place to study and work
Lecturers are friendly. Pay is good and hours are flexible for student ambassadors. However the same cannot be said across the company. Lecturers earn pennies while idiots in Registry earn 50k.
cons: Sell out University, no morals. Senior management team are terrible - nasty, intimidating and condescending, borderline bullies. Staff show clear favouritism towards students, certain students are given senior paid positions which creates unfairness in shift allocation and an unusual dynamic between students as well as breaching GDPR. Communication between departments is nonexistent and everything needs constant chasing up. Visiting American students are entitled and rude and make campus unbearable. Terrible company culture and history of discrimination, gossip and normalised sexual harassment between staff/students, no amount of enforcing policy would fix this. The University is ran by incompetent people who constantly hire more incompetent people. Zero regard for mental health and no sense of fairness. Do not attend here or work here.
Inflation brings about the need for a pay rise.

pros:
Fantastic academic staff, best minds in British academia, helpful, down to earth and enthusiastic.

Fantastic partnership with US university.

Fantastic starting and mid level professional teams, very friendly.
cons:
Very poor professional senior management team , way out of their depth.

Poor communication with between management and staff, lack of transparency. 

Not looking after good employees. 

No real progression prospects. 

Poor salaries. 

Chaotic, unorganised, dealing mainly with fires.

pros: Good relationship building opportunity. Reputable Institution
cons: Short term role, only an opporunity for half a year.

pros: lots of perks to the job

cons: Very heavy workload. Centralised top down management. No space time or support for research. Like working in an old style polytechnic.

review_title: Great team to gain experience with
pros: Kind and considerate team, exposure to different types of marketing
cons: Small team creates limited opportunities for progression
